remarks.format:
## Remarks When sorting is enabled by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.AllowSorting%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control to `true`, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> controls are rendered in the header of each column that has the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.SortExpression%2A> property set. (For automatically generated columns, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.SortExpression%2A> property contains the same value as the data field.) These links allow you to sort the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control by the selected column. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.SortCommand> event is raised when a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> control is clicked.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of DataGridSortCommandEventArgs, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridSortCommandEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the CommandSource property to get the command source that raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.SortCommand> event. Because this event is raised only when a link is clicked in the header of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control, the returned source is a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> object that represents the header. This property can be used to programmatically control the header.
